p: The phospholipase production was determined by the zone of precipitation around the fungal colony according to Samaranayake et al. using a slightly modified method [ 24 ]. The egg-yolk agar medium consisted of SDA (13 g; Merck, Germany), NaCl (11.7 g), CaCl2 (0.111 g), and 10% sterile egg yolk. Therefore, 10 µl of the yeast suspension (106 cells/ml) was inoculated on the egg-yolk medium with C. carvi EO (160 μg/ml) and fluconazole (2 μg/ml). The precipitation zone around the fungal colony was measured after incubation at 35ºC for 72 h.
